subject: Re: [junit] Re: Problems with assertEquals()
msgSnippet: ... assertEquals(object1, object2) is also correct, the message doesn t affect the result. (See the JUnit source code.) Checking the class does something
messageBody:
> use assertEquals("failure",object1.getClass(),object2.getClass());
>
> it is working
> check once.

assertEquals(object1, object2) is also correct, the message doesn't affect
the result. (See the JUnit source code.)

Checking the class does something completely different.
I don't think the original poster wanted to compare the classes.

Robert
